item.title: Steam borrowing & sharing?
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
sersoft:

I wasn’t trying to be clever or anything, I’m genuinely used to typing it like that.

at this point in time, hte "$ = ‘S’ " thing is more of a physical representation of our views of certain companies, usually used at times when we just cant bring ourselves to express said view in broader detail

besides, MS screwed up big time, even after the DRM reversal, the anger within the consumer is still present

Read full topic

item.title: Steam borrowing & sharing?
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Yeah, they exist to make money. Doesn’t mean they have to be dicks about it.

It’s perfectly possible to make a quality product and market it without all of the anti-consumer douchebaggery they heaped on the Xbone.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam borrowing & sharing?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Companies like to make money, it’s what they do.

Besides, that joke is so fucking old. It hasn’t been funny for a decade.

It’s like people expect Microsoft to read that and go “Oh my god, he wrote Microsoft with a dollar sign for an S! I now see the error of our ways and shall change the whole company’s attitude from now on…”

It’s just stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam borrowing & sharing?
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Micro$oft has always had a reputation as a corporate monster aiming to monopolize and exploit, and that’s why people sometimes replace the S with the dollar sign. Not that the Xbone’s initial reveal did much to dissuade that reputation…

Read full topic

item.title: Steam borrowing & sharing?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Sweet I really hope this is true, I would love to be able to trade and share digital games. It’s one of the only things that digital games have ever really lacked. Plus it could actually help cut down piracy, or at least the perception of it. It’s so often said, “I only pirate to try games, and I buy the ones I like”. Well if your friend has it, now you could try it without risking piracy! And who knows, Valve could even set up some kind of system to lend you games for free directly from them for a limited time, giving you another way to demo the game.

And it would be absolutely AMAZING if you could actually trade games for steam wallet money or something. It’s so well known how many people buy games on a whim on Steam sales that it’s become a joke. How great would it be to turn shelved impulse buy games into credit to buy games you really want? Course that doesn’t seem to be implied at all and it’s more of wishful thinking based on some comments in that thread, but still…that would be great. sighs

Read full topic
